content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why cabinet secretaries might not aggressively pursue the president’s policy agenda?

choices.label: Cabinet secretaries are unlikely to be members of the president’s party.
Cabinet secretaries may develop strong loyalty to their departments.
Cabinet secretaries are likely to compete with the president in a subsequent election.
Under the Hatch Act, cabinet secretaries are prohibited from campaigning on behalf of the president.
The Freedom of Information Act compels cabinet secretaries to divulge confidential information to the media.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors illustrated in different scenarios in context.
